main event: Two military personnel spotted a round, silver object while driving near Sheridan, Wyoming on April 4, 1961.
interesting points: The object was estimated to be about 80-100 feet in diameter and flying at an altitude of 4,000 to 5,000 feet., It was observed to fly at an estimated speed of 500-700 mph., The object executed a sweeping arc and appeared to follow the car of the witnesses., The weather was clear with unlimited visibility during the sighting., The object was described as rotating clockwise and oscillating at times.
witness description: two military personnel, one officer and one enlisted man
